topics.title: The first video of the Zeronet?
topics.body: I just blogged a video at /karsten.bit :) #first?

topics.title: A new barrier has been breached @ karsten.bit -- advertisement has now been introduced to Zeronet!
topics.body: For just 1mBTC/month, your advertisement can be shown on Zeronet's #1 active blog!

4@6.body:
> [Oxilic](#comment_16_6): You should add a blog or something it's kinda empty right now :P 
> Added it as "Karsten's site" as I'm not sure what you're going to put there, if you want to change it just tell me. 

Thanks!

1@77.body:
> [unknown](#comment_6_90): Hello 1CP7VD25Z3W2nYzJ4CUcnTQt7YpMQW8dhT! /u/WarsawsBlinkingLight
> Did you sign and publish?

I think so, could you retry now?

> [unknown](#comment_7_90): same

Strange, I have other people that are confirming that it works.

> [unknown](#comment_8_90): I just got the update.

Nice! Do you see all three posts?

> [unknown](#comment_10_90): Yes and your Bitmessage address

A video, a picture and the BM address?

> [unknown](#comment_11_90): Video works, but I see no picture.

Are you running on Mac, Linux or Windows?

> [unknown](#comment_12_90): Linux debian

Ok, try to update the site now. You may have to do it from ZeroHello.

> [unknown](#comment_13_90): got it.
> subway?

Yes :) The Oslosian t-bane!

1@105.body:
Press the windows button.
Type in cmd, press enter.
Now the command line should be open.
Navigate to the folder where you have the zeronet files.
To enter a folder, write in 'cd foldername' and press enter. (without the ')

When you have navigated in your command line to your zeronet folder, paste
'zeronet.py siteCreate'
(again, without the ')

Voila, a new site!
